newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's Penoles clarifies hedging plans.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's Penoles clarifies hedging plans.

text.p: Industrias Penoles, the world's largest refined silver producer, clarified late Thursday its hedging policies for metals in 1997.
A company spokesman told Reuters that Penoles' current hedging exposures were 20 percent of gold mine production, 30 percent of silver mine production, and 5 percent of zinc mine output.
He stressed these were current hedging levels for the metals and that they could change over the year, according to market movements and how the company felt towards price variations.

After a recent conference call with analysts, brokerages said in reports that the hedging levels were those to be maintained by Penoles throughout 1997. "This is not the case, our levels could change with market conditions," the spokesman added.
